name: Grand Summit Resort Hotel and Conference Center

reviews.title: This hotel was okay
reviews.text: We stayed here in the fall which is obviously is not there busy season. The hotel was quiet. I only saw two other people the two nights we were there and that was at checkout. The hotel rooms are dated and the tv's are very little. The shower was okay. The beds are dated and not very comfortable. The pool and hot tub were being remodeled so weren't available. Which was fine. The lady checking us in offered to move us to jordan resort if we wanted a pool. We had issues with our tv remote and called the front desk. Our remote finally started working after 20 minutes and still no sign of maintenance..called the front desk to tell them it was working and they didn't apologize that no one ever showed up. There is a restaurant at the hotel. we didn't eat there though. This is probably a fun place to stay in the winter ski season but I wouldn't probably stay there again in the off season.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Summit at Sunday River the week of July 4th. We stayed in Unit #368. Overall, the room was very spacious and clean. Only 2 complaints about the room: the bed was old and VERY uncomfortable. The sofa bed was more comfortable. And the shower had low water pressure. Other than that, not bad. As timeshare owners, I would expect a comfortable night's sleep and we did not receive that. Helen, in concierge, was awesome! It was cool during our stay so the heated outdoor pool was nice in the evening. Hot tub was decent. We did not eat in the restaurant so I can't comment on that. We brought a portable propane grill to use on our deck but were told they were not allowed. So when we wanted to cook out, we had to cook in the parking lot. You also cannot store your bikes in your room. We had to check them at the front desk each day (which was a hike in itself). Take a hike up the mountain - you may come face to face with a moose as we did. We kayaked on the Androscoggin. There's a small B&B down the street (Briar Lea), I would recommend eating there. If you sit in the bar, eventually you will be socializing with everyone. Also, check out the trails and sights in Grafton Notch State Park. Because of the rainy weather and the fact that we wanted a good night's sleep, we actually left a day early. But overall, I would recommend this property. Sunday River is definately a winter resort as there's not much going on in the summer. But if you like hiking, biking and kayaking this is the place for you!
reviews.title: Beautiful property!

reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE! The photo on the outside bares no resemblance to the horrors inside. Also. The best advice I can give you: if you book here remember to bring your own bedding. You will thank me for this priceless advice.

reviews.text: The skiing itself is good however.
reviews.title: Stay any where else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a last minute ski and stay special this past weekend. 2 Lift tickets, room, breakfast was included with no minimum stay required. We arrived early, picked up our lift tickets, left our bags at the ski check and we skied from the Summit over to Barker and South Ridge. Upon our return to the Summit, we checked in early to our standard hotel room with 2 queen beds. The room was average hotel quality but very clean and well maintained. The outdoor pool and hot tub were perfect (compared to our past visit when it was too cold). We enjoyed dinner At the Peak! We took the Chandola up to the lodge and had a great dinner experience. Sunday River’s good attempt at fine dining experience on the Mountain…a little over done but it was a fun time with great food and music. We slept well with no neighbors on either side of us or across the hall which was great! (One stay we had banging doors in the hall all night) The buffet breakfast the next day was filling and good quality. The Starbucks coffee hit the spot. I would not recommend paying full price for a stay at the Grand Summit….but you can’t beat the convenience of staying on the mountain. Tip: Sign up for the email specials and check back on the website mid week for last minute deals.
reviews.title: Great Deal - Great Weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, Dec. 18-20, 2008. We wanted a ski getaway before Christmas. I liked this hotel very much. Check in was great. We arrived in the early evening. There was a lot of snow and it was cold, but a valet parker was very eager to help us out with our bags. We did not valet park but he helped us anyway. Our room was VERY SMALL (studio kitchenette) but nice. We had a room with a Murphy bed. I couldn't get the door to the balcony open but that was probably just because it had snowed over 6" the day before. The bed mattress was not the best of comfort but what do you expect for a Murphy bed. The kitchen in the room was nice. It had everything we needed to cook our lunches and dinners. The breakfast was AMAZING. It was included in our package and I was shocked at the amount of hot food available in the buffet. There was even a women that cooked an omelet for you. Oh, and the coffee was Starbucks! The pool and hot tub were both outside but you never had to walk out in the cold because they had a feature where you could swim through the curtain that took you outside. I thought this was real nice. Also, inside they had a sauna and steam room. The gym was great too!
reviews.title: A great stay!

likes.liked: — How close it was to the slopes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part about this hotel was how close it was to slopes. They had a room where they checked your skis and it was right next to the door that you could ski out of. You could literally see the lift from looking out the door! I loved being able to ski right to the hotel door.
reviews.title: Older Property

reviews.text: Overall the Grand Summit Resort was great! The price, staff, and room were all great. I would go back in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Well I think it's great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a small studio room for a few days during the summer season. The hotel was more or less deserted, staff included, which caused a few inconveniences. The rooms are very dated, and the quality of bedding- mattress, linens and the whole package- was very poor in our room. The a/c was an indoor/outdoor wall unit that was both enormously loud and inefficient. The only major plus I would give this hotel is it's location (at least during ski season) and it's "Green" message, including recycling bins in the room along with regular trash cans. Probably will not return to this hotel unless major renovations occur.
reviews.title: Bethel's Best.
Noisy, stripped-down rooms
reviews.text: I stayed here on business and was very disappointed in the rooms. It was obvious that they are geared toward clientel that would trash them in a second - not a single picture on the walls, cheap furniture, ugly carpeting and decor, polyethelene shower/tubs, etc. etc. And very noisy - can hear everything from people walking down the hall to the TV in the room next door. And, the rooms were hot - unable to turn down heat. Luckily the windows opened. No luxury here, that's for sure.

reviews.title: Worth the drive
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Summit Resort Hotel on the Weekend of Jan. 20-21. Although the room was clean, and spacious enough, we did not get as we expected. We were told that we would get a Studio Deluxe with kitchenette and ended up with a standard room with 2 beds. This was unexpected, but explained by "first come, first serve", and we arrived after 9pm after an over 5 hour drive.
Restaurants are pricey, remember to bring sufficient cash for the Moonstuck Cafe (over $30 for 3 people's sandwiches) and the pizzaria down the road only takes cash.
reviews.title: Beware the religous conservatives
Robbed
reviews.text: The Legends Restaurant in the Hotel is more "fancy" and definitely quite pricey. No children's menu was offered, and selection was not appropriate for a 12 year-old.
